title: Permanent Inkbrush
paragraphs: The Permanent Inkbrush is a main weapon in Splatoon and Splatoon 2. It is a recolored Inkbrush with a different sub weapon and special weapon loadout.

The Permanent Inkbrush shares its overall design with the Inkbrush. However, the Permanent Inkbrush's handle is red instead of blue, there is a small sticker on the ferrule, and the bristles are slightly darker.
The Permanent Inkbrush is one of eight weapons included in Sheldon's Picks Vol. 1 and was released at  02:00 UTC on 13 April 2016.[1] It comes with Splat Bombs and Kraken.

The Permanent Inkbrush is an Inkbrush with a modded setup, allowing for a new playstyle! Open up a hole in the opponents' defences with Splat Bombs and zip in to pressure them! If that's not destructive enough for you, unleash the Kraken and go on a rampage! This is a set for aggressive battlers with a simply uncontrollable urge to wreak maximum havoc!(NA)

The Permanent Inkbrush is an Inkbrush with an adjusted setup, allowing for a new playstyle! Open up a hole in the opponents' defences with Splat Bombs and zip in to pressure them! If that's not destructive enough for you, unleash the Kraken and go on a rampage! This is a set for aggressive battlers with a simply uncontrollable urge to cause devastation!(EU/OC)
The Permanent Inkbrush was released on 3 April 2019 at 01:00 UTC as part of Version 4.6.0.[4] It comes with Sprinklers and Ink Armor.

The Permanent Inkbrush will get you the same functionality as its non-permanent namesake, but the new loadout lets you play your way! Toss out a Sprinkler sub and let it do the inking for you, then when it's time to attack, activate your Ink Armor and swim into the fray! For those looking to leave their mark by inking, inking, and more inking, give this wash-resistant set a try!

"Permanent" refers to permanent markers and permanent ink.

- The Permanent Inkbrush is a middleweight weapon.

- Ink consumption while rolling is 8.1% per second.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- Ink consumption per attack is 2%.
This allows players to attack 50 times before needing to refill the ink supply.
This stat can be changed with Ink Saver (Main).

- When attacking with a depleted ink tank, ink will not be flung until enough ink has recovered.
- Rolling with a depleted ink tank will not leave a trail or damage opponents.
- The Permanent Inkbrush can be swung every 6 frames (10 swings per second).
- When rolling, the player's movement speed is set to 1.92 units per frame.
- When rolling on an uninkable surface or with a depleted ink tank, the player's movement speed is set to 0.96 units per frame.
- After rolling, there is a 0.33 second cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.
- After swinging, there is a 0.5 second cooldown before the ink tank starts refilling.
- Hitting an opponent while rolling deals 20 damage.

- Attacks have a base damage of 28.
This weapon has a critical damage mechanic, so the damage dealt with one swing may be higher than this value.
- For normal attacks, ink loses damage based on distance traveled. Ink starts losing damage at 50 units and stops losing damage at 100 units. The minimum damage is 14.
- Ink globs travel straight for 5 frames.
- Damage does not change based on the angle of the ink.
- When rolling, the Permanent Inkbrush leaves an ink trail that is 12 units wide.
